page.title: 09ROADS/TRANSPORT/ACCIDENTS
page.content: ROADS The a265 runs along the path of a Roman road and coincides with the line of the Greenwich Meridian. This road was once an iron age track and was about 3000 years old. It was th only route to the sea without using rivers. Bell lane is also very old. TRANSPORT The bus service is not good. Each day 6 buses go through Danehill to Haywards Heath and 4 come through on the way to East Grinstead. The Southdown Bus Company can not do anything about this as the bus routes and times are up to the council. ACCIDENTS There are few accidents. Most of them happen at the chicane by Danehill Church involving either cars or motorbikes.
